statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Howard gets by NC A&T 53-47 in MEAC 1st round
article.headline: Howard gets by NC A&T 53-47 in MEAC 1st round
article.linkText: Howard gets by NC A&T 53-47 in MEAC 1st round
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. -- Prince Okoroh hit two free throws with 13 seconds left for a four-point lead as No. 8 seed Howard beat ninth-seeded North Carolina A&T 53-47 in the first round of the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference tournament on Tuesday. Howard will play top-seeded North Carolina Central on Wednesday. Solomon Mangham led Howard (8-24) with 14 points and Okoroh had 13. Lamont Middleton scored 19 points for North Carolina A&T (9-23), the defending MEAC tournament champions. Neither team shot above 30 percent in the game. NC A&T took its first lead of the second half, 44-43, on a 3-pointer by Jeremy Underwood with 5:05 left. Then Howard's James Miller responded with a trey of his own. With 2:33 left, NC A&T's Lamont Middleton converted a three-point play to regain the lead -- but the Aggies would not score again. James Daniel's 3-pointer put Howard up for good at 49-47.
